topic: Worked Examples: Faster Skill Acquisition with Less Cognitive Load
target_audience: math/science teachers and students learning procedures

refs.content: Across K–postsecondary math, worked examples show medium effect (g≈0.48); stronger when not overloading with prompts.
Instructional explanations often yield small benefits unless targeted at learners' knowledge gaps.
Combining examples with tutored problem solving and fading can produce durable transfer.

special_instructions: Provide templates for fully worked → partially worked (fading). Show incorrect-example use and when to switch to problems.
